description: Describes the attributes for the specified load balancer.

parameters.name: LoadBalancerName
parameters.description: The name of the load balancer.

nested_items.name: LoadBalancerAttributes
nested_items.description: Information about the load balancer attributes.

nested_items.name: CrossZoneLoadBalancing
nested_items.description: If enabled, the load balancer routes the request traffic evenly across all instances regardless of the Availability Zones.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Specifies whether cross-zone load balancing is enabled for the load balancer.

nested_items.name: AccessLog
nested_items.description: If enabled, the load balancer captures detailed information of all requests and delivers the information to the Amazon S3 bucket that you specify.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Specifies whether access logs are enabled for the load balancer.

nested_items.name: S3BucketName
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where the access logs are stored.

nested_items.name: EmitInterval
nested_items.description: The interval for publishing the access logs. You can specify an interval of either 5 minutes or 60 minutes.

nested_items.name: S3BucketPrefix
nested_items.description: The logical hierarchy you created for your Amazon S3 bucket, for example my-bucket-prefix/prod. If the prefix is not provided, the log is placed at the root level of the bucket.

nested_items.name: ConnectionDraining
nested_items.description: If enabled, the load balancer allows existing requests to complete before the load balancer shifts traffic away from a deregistered or unhealthy instance.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Specifies whether connection draining is enabled for the load balancer.

nested_items.name: Timeout
nested_items.description: The maximum time, in seconds, to keep the existing connections open before deregistering the instances.

nested_items.name: ConnectionSettings
nested_items.description: If enabled, the load balancer allows the connections to remain idle (no data is sent over the connection) for the specified duration.

nested_items.name: IdleTimeout
nested_items.description: The time, in seconds, that the connection is allowed to be idle (no data has been sent over the connection) before it is closed by the load balancer.

elb.http.desyncmitigationmode - Determines how the load balancer handles requests that might pose a security risk to your application. The possible values are monitor, defensive, and strictest. The default is defensive.
